Hi, thank you for visiting my page. I hope this website can tell you a bit more about me, what I do in my role as your Maidstone Borough Councillor and why I want to stand to be a Kent County Councillor for the Cranbrook Division. I also have a Facebook page which I update frequently with useful links, events and more information about how I am representing the residents of my ward.
Search on Facebook for : claudinerussell
or click the link button below.

* Leader of the Opposition
*Full Council
*Chair of Overview and Scrutiny Committee
* Planning and Healthier, Stronger Communities Committee
* Substitute member Planning Committee
*Substitute member Licensing Committee

Marden and Yalding Ward at Maidstone Borough Council
KCC Candidate for Cranbrook Division
What I do
As a Borough Councillor my role is to represent and help the residents of my Ward.
If I were lucky enough to be elected as a County Councillor my role would be to help the residents of my division and aid the transition towards a unitary authority.
I regularly speak to residents and I encourage residents to contact me via my email claudinerussell@maidstone.gov.uk
I also regularly attend Parish council meetings in my Ward :
Marden Parish Council
Yalding Parish Council
Nettlestead Parish Council
Collier Street Parish Council
I have started to attend Parish council meetings in the Cranbrook Division and have so far attended :
Cranbrook Parish Council
Hawkhurst Parish Council
Goudhurst Parish Council
Frittenden Parish Council
Working for my community
So far I have been assisting and helping residents with issues such as:
Liasing with Housing Providers to help residents with issues.
Speaking at Maidstone Borough Council Planning Committee.
Assisting residents to combat anti-social issues with the help of the MBC Community Protection Team.
Highlighting issues with development to the MBC Planning Enforcement Team.
Helping residents to report and clear fly-tipping.
Represent my ward residents at any committee as a ward councillor and speak on their behalf.
Help with missed bin collections.
Work with external partners such as the Environment Agency on issues affecting my ward.
Regular contact and liaising with the Kent Police Community Support Officer (PCSO) on issues affecting my ward.
and much more...
Maidstone Borough Council Committee meetings
I currently lead the Conservative Group at Maidstone Borough Council, I sit on various committees, I chair Overview and Scrutiny holding the administration to account and I give our group response to the Leaders Speech at Full Council
In this role, as well as representing my ward, I am involved in the discussions and voting on decisions which affect all areas in the Borough of Maidstone.
I also regularly attend Councillor training and briefing meetings
As a councillor I attend many training courses to further my knowledge and ensure that I am up to date, notably:
Planning training sessions
Licensing training sessions
Local plan Review workshops
Accounts Briefings
Leadership training with the Local Government Association
In addition to meetings with outside bodies such as the Environment Agency etc.

Stories and Headlines
Article from the KentOnline
23 February, 2021
From Protest to Power?
Housing campaigner Claudine Russell to stand for Conservatives on Maidstone Council.
The leader of the Marden Planning Opposition Group, which successfully convinced Maidstone council to drop plans for a 2,000 garden village in Marden, has decided to go into politics.
Claudine Russell is to stand for the Conservatives at the borough council elections on May 6 contesting Marden and Yalding ward...... read the full article by clicking the link button below

Marden and Yalding Ward at Maidstone Borough Council
KCC Candidate for Cranbrook Division
Testimonials
"Claudine Russell is a phenomenal champion for the Kentish countryside. She's been fighting for years to get the infrastructure our area badly needs, and against overdevelopment.
Whether its saving Weald schooling or getting police officers back out on our streets, she knows what matters most in Cranbrook and the villages around it."
Katie Lam MP
‘‘Claudine is a fantastic and formidable campaigner who always has the best interests of her community in Marden and Yalding at heart.
She was the driving force behind the extremely successful campaign to protect Marden from the totally inappropriate plans to impose 2000 houses on the village. It was my privilege to work with her on this campaign where I observed her truly remarkable persistence, determination and ability to influence decision makers.
I can think of nobody better than Claudine to stand up for the interests of the people of Marden and Yalding on Maidstone Borough Council.’’

Why is it important to vote in this particular local election?
These elections are the last time that you will elect anyone to Kent County Council as we move towards unitary authorities. I would love the chance to be that person, to represent you to the best of my ability and to make sure that our area is well positioned to make the best of the new arrangements.
This election isn't about the bins (that's currently a district function), it is about you, the residents and making sure that your views are heard loud and clear, about the lack of infrastructure, about the overdevelopment of our beautiful countryside and about the way that local representatives work for you. I love the Weald, I live in the Weald, I farm the Weald and I've fought for the Weald. I would love it if you would place your faith in me to fight for your voice and the voice of our Weald to be heard in the last term at County Hall. It would be the honour of my life to serve you.

Marden and Yalding Ward at Maidstone Borough Council
KCC Candidate for Cranbrook Division
About Me
I live and work on our family livestock farm in the beautiful Weald of Kent with my husband Tristan and our two teenage children. I built and run a horse livery that provides local jobs including apprenticeships.
I have a degree in Earth Sciences and have worked in both the private and the public sector and have amassed a variety of transferrable skills. I work as an Environmental Advisor part time for the private sector.
I love farming and rural life and am passionate about British Food, the quality of our farming here in Britain and the value of food security. We must seek to preserve our rural identity, our sustainable farming methods and our high standards.
Family Life
I am married to Tristan (a farmer) and have lived on the family farm just outside of Marden for 18 years. The farm has a rich history and has been in my husbands family since 1866! We have two children, Evie and George.
Tristan is really more a “farmer builder” than a farmer (that’s what the kids call him) and he built the horse livery that I now manage on the farm. I employ local people and take on apprentices from time to time to train. I really enjoy combining my love of the outdoors with family time and my own special interest of riding horses and providing them with the best care.
Tristan and I applied for and got Higher Level Stewardship for the farm working with Natural England and have now been managing the farm to maximise environmental benefits and educational access since 2009.
